"A SOLE TOR EVERYBODY (Selecting ana Utilizing

VIDEO
AUDIO
Teacher demonstrates evi¬
dences of need for tech¬
nical adjustments by expert
SHE EMPHASIZES THAT TEACHERS SHOULD
BE ABLE TO RECOGNIZE THESE SO THEY
WILL KNOW WHEN TO CALL FOR HELP.
TEACHER MIGHT REFER HERE TO OTHER
MATERIALS IN THE KIT, OR SAY THAT
THERE ARE SOME EXCELLENT PUBLICATIONS
WHICH TELL IN SOME DETAIL WHAT TO
LOOK FOR WHEN BUYING A TELEVISION
RECEIVER FOR THE CLASSROOM...AND HOW
TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THE SPEAKER.
ALSO GIVE MORE DETAIL WITH REFERENCE
TO OTHER TECHNICAL ASPECTS„
TEACHER MAY SAY ALSO THAT THE PURCHASE
OF SETS AND DECISIONS WITH REFERENCE
TO ANTENNA INSTALLATION ARE ADMINIS¬
TRATIVE DECISIONS. HOWEVER, IT IS
HELPFUL FOR THE TEACHER TO KNOW SOME
OF THE BASIC THINGS, IN ORDER THAT
SHE MAY ADVISE WITH REFERENCE TO SUCH
PURCHASE OR INSTALLATION, IF ASKED
TO DO SO.
THE TEACHER SAYS IT IS TIME FOR HER
TO GET BACK TO THE CLASS, AS THE
TELEVISION LESSON WILL SOON START*
AND THERE ARE A FEW POINTS SHE WANTS
TO TALK OVER WITH THE STUDENTS AS
BACKGROUND FOR TODAY’S LESSON. SHE
SAYS SHE WILL BE WORKING WITH THE
CLASS ON SOME OF THEIR IMMEDIATE,
SHORT-RANGE FOLLOW-THROUGH ACTIVITIES
WHEN THE LESSON IS OVER...SO SHE
LIKELY WON’T HAVE ANOTHER OPPORTUNITY
TO SPEAK TO US...BUT SHE HOPES WE WILL
ENJOY OUR EXPERIENCES WITH TELEVISION
IN THE CLASSROOM, AS SHE HAS.
As teacher goes back to take
her place in the classroom,
the scene fades. Narrator
comes into the foreground.
